page.title: 06Cockermouth school 2
page.content: Cockermouth school is in two buidlings. The Lorton Road Site, on the edge of the town, was the old Cockermouth Grammar School, originally a school for boys sentenced by the courts. On this site there are 173 1st year pupils, 180 in the 2nd year, and 127 in the Sixth form, a total of 480 pupils. There are 25 teaching rooms, a library with 3000 books and a small gymnasium. The sports field has a cricket pitch, 2 rugby and hockey pitches and a small football pitch. In school all the usual subjects are taught. Boys play rugby,soccer and cricket, while girls play netball, hockey and tennis. School teams compete in these sports against other local schools. Other activities include a choir, dance club and a war games club,which the sixth form help to run.
